Method Detail

getBeanAction

public CallbackAction getBeanAction()
Description copied from interface: SingleBeanPanelDef
Gets the panel action. A SingleBeanPanel allows an action to be performed. This is the action performed by the panel. Such an action can be a CRUD operation, or another action that takes the panel's bean as input. If this is null, the executeButton is hidden.

Specified by:
getBeanAction in interface SingleBeanPanelDef<B extends Serializable>
Returns:
Returns the action

getBeanFieldsPanelCreator

public PanelCreator<B> getBeanFieldsPanelCreator()
Description copied from interface: SingleBeanPanelDef
Gets the PanelCreator. The PanelCreator creates a panel that contains the fields of the bean form and has them bound to the IModel that is supplied. No Form is required in the created Panel.

Specified by:

getBeanModel

public org.apache.wicket.model.IModel<B> getBeanModel()
Description copied from interface: BeanPanelDef
Gets the model of the panel. This property intends to allow the users to specify whichever model implementation they prefer. The model object cannot be null. Users can use this to retrieve the object of this panel, for example at the implementation of the beanAction.

Specified by:
getBeanModel in interface BeanPanelDef<B extends Serializable>

the model of the panel.

setFormValidator

public void setFormValidator(AjaxEnabledCondition<B> validator)
Description copied from interface: SingleBeanPanelDef
[OPTIONAL] Sets a Condition that checks the selected item before submitting the beanForm. The validator's check(B b) method returns true if the validation is successful. The intention is to alert the user that erroneous input has been added and correct it. There is, however the possibility that the user will press cancel instead. This may lead to inconsistent data, as the beanModel has been modified already (even though the UI may not indicate this). For this reason, it is preferred to work with a temporary copy of the bean until the user changes have been validated.

Specified by:
setFormValidator in interface SingleBeanPanelDef<B extends Serializable>
Parameters:
validator - The validator to set.

setBeanFieldsPanelMode

public void setBeanFieldsPanelMode(PanelCreatorMode mode)
Description copied from interface: ModeAwareBeanPanelDef
[OPTIONAL] Sets the PanelCreatorMode of the beanFieldsPanel. In some cases, it is essential for the beanFieldsPanelCreator to be aware of the type of action this panel supports. For example, an edit bean action may require different UI than a new bean action.

Specified by:
setBeanFieldsPanelMode in interface ModeAwareBeanPanelDef<B extends Serializable>
Parameters:
mode - The PanelCreatorMode to set.

setShowClearButton

public void setShowClearButton(Boolean showClearButton)
Description copied from interface: SingleBeanPanelDef
[OPTIONAL] Sets the showClearButton. If the appearance of a clear form button is required, this should be set to true. This works by creating a new bean instance and setting it as the form model object. SingleBeanPanel attempts to create the instance by resolving the bean class and using the default constructor. If this raises a RuntimeException, the user must override method newBean() explicitly. This property defaults to false.

Specified by:
setShowClearButton in interface SingleBeanPanelDef<B extends Serializable>

setSingleBeanFormContainsFileUpload

public void setSingleBeanFormContainsFileUpload(Boolean singleBeanFormContainsFileUpload)
Description copied from interface: SingleBeanPanelDef
[OPTIONAL] Sets whether the single bean panel form includes a file upload item. If this is set to true, the single bean panel form is set as setMultipart(true). Defaults to false.

Specified by:
